name: Bells Used Plugin for MuseScore 1.2
body:
### Bells Used Plugin for MuseScore 1.2

Bells Used Plugin is for [MuseScore 1.2](http://musescore.org), it generates Bells Used information and can present it in a score format, a text file, or as CSV file for use with spreadsheet software.

### Getting Started

To Install Bells Used Plugin:
* Download the Zip file.
* Unzip the file.
* Close MuseScore.
* Place the files in the [MuseScore Plugin Directory](http://musescore.org/en/handbook/plugins).
* Load MuseScore.
* The plugin can be accessed from the Plugin->Bells Used Menu

### Using the Plugin

When you are ready to create a Bells Used Chart select it from the plugin menu:
![Bells Used Menu Location: Plugin->Bells Used->Create Bells Used](http://raw.github.com/nbarnard/img/master/bells-used/menu.png)

There are several options that can be selected each time the plugin is run. By default the plugin will store your last used options.

#### Score
By default the Bells Used Plugin will create a new score:
![Dialog at defaults](http://raw.github.com/nbarnard/img/master/bells-used/dialog-default.png)

#### Plain Text
![Dialog with Text Selected](http://raw.github.com/nbarnard/img/master/bells-used/dialog-text.png)

When Plain Text output is selected there are two additional options available:
* Use "Real" sharps and flats: When checked the plugin will use Unicode Sharp, Flat, Double Sharp, and Double Flat symbols in text outputs. Uncheck this option if the text is not readable. If this option is unchecked the plugin will output "#" for Sharps and "b" for Flats, utilizing two of each for Double Sharps and Double Flats
* Copy to Clipboard: When checked, the plugin will copy the Bells Used information to the clipboard instead of saving the information to a file.

#### CSV
![Dialog with CSV Selected](http://raw.github.com/nbarnard/img/master/bells-used/dialog-csv.png)

When CSV output is selected, all the plain text options are available, and an additional option is available:
* Include Header Row: When checked, the first row of the CSV file will have a header describing each of the columns. 


### Additional features
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: Flexible Bells Used Information for Composers and Directors
